tweets.html:
Popularity of Olympic archery attributed to HUNGER GAMES influence. Difference being the Capitol televised more major events live.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) August 2, 2012

I totally get it with the Olympics, but are you telling me that "Wipeout" is tape delayed too?! #shameful

— Jack Burditt (@jackburditt) August 3, 2012

"The most important thing is for him to get off with everyone." PHRASING! #olympics

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) August 3, 2012

The only state that doesn't have Bigfoot sightings is Hawaii. That's because of their extensive Bigfoot population control programs. #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 3, 2012

Animal Planet seems to be ... arguing that Bigfoot is almost definitely real. Am I not understanding? #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 3, 2012

At this rate, very soon, Hillbilly Handfishin' is going to be Animal Planet's Breaking Bad. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 3, 2012

One guy has a hat that says, "Gone Squatchin' " .....Sigh. He looks like he's on 30 Rock.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 3, 2012

"If Bigfoot is there, he will be found." Animal Planet executive is confident! #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 3, 2012

Very punchy day. Animal Planet executive asked what they will do with the show after they find Bigfoot. #tcas12

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) August 3, 2012

Do you remember the Ghost Hunters show that ran for, like, ever? They never found a real ghost. Hmmmm.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 3, 2012

You might be surprised, but the questions on this "Finding Bigfoot" session are a tad, um, sarcastic?

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 3, 2012

@nprmonkeysee @BastardMachine I WASN'T BEING SARCASTIC! I WANNA KNOW!

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) August 3, 2012

Poor, misunderstood @HitFixDaniel. He'll never get his answers about Bigfoot.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) August 3, 2012

"Jane Goodall believes these things are real so she may know a litte bit more about it than you do." - Annoyed panelist.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 3, 2012

You guys, @HitFixDaniel knows Bigfoot is out there. He's got a whole presentation! #tcas12

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) August 3, 2012

I need to emphasize: My "Finding Bigfoot" question wasn't sarcastic! I wanna know what Animal Planet is gonna do when they're found!

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) August 3, 2012

Forget Bigfoot. There's a man named "Bobo" and a woman who looks like Justin Bieber in 10 years on stage. Let's focus. #tcas12

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) August 3, 2012

"You can't compare mermaids to Bigfoot." One increasingly annoyed Bigfoot panelist who didn't like the laughter after he said it.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 3, 2012

We were just called ignorant for not believing in Bigfoot. Also for comparing it to a mermaid. I mean... #TCAs12

— Danielle Turchiano (@danielletbd) August 3, 2012

"You can't equate mermaids to Bigfoot" says the indignant, sleeveless "Bigfoot Researcher" in trucker cap named Bobo. #tcas12

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) August 3, 2012

This is turning into Animal Planet's Aaron Sorkin panel.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 3, 2012

Mermaids aren't real?

— Burley (@BurleytheKoala) August 3, 2012

Here's what I know about "Finding Bigfoot": On the cable #TCA schedule, it's listed as a "fantasy investigative series." So, yeah.

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) August 3, 2012

Bobo just did his Bigfoot call to end this session. I loved this session.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) August 3, 2012

Just in time for TV critics at #TCAs12 to disperse and head home: A panel for a Discovery Channel documentary on plane crashes! #TCAs12

— Amber M. Ray (@rayamberm) August 3, 2012

Last panel of the day on #DiscoveryChannel planned 727 plane crash w/ test dummies. Makes me glad I drove down for this. #tcas12

— Susan Young (@Suetube) August 3, 2012

SERIOUSLY?! RT @HuffPostCeleb: 50-year-old actress wears super short skirt http://t.co/QxPAbqvy

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) August 3, 2012

Really going to miss Michael Phelps swimming in the 2016 Olympics. Debbie Phelps crowd shots not so much.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) August 3, 2012

That was nice of gymnastics to just wait for a couple hours to let the swimmers race.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) August 3, 2012

For 3 hrs I've been yelling at Olympic athletes "to pick it up" while I sit on my sofa trying to work up the energy to shave

— Jack Burditt (@jackburditt) August 3, 2012

Huge kudos to all the gymnasts for not using "Cotton Eyed Joe" as floor exercise music. Much appreciated.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) August 3, 2012

If the lead story on your local news broadcast is about a perv neurologist using an upskirt camera, maybe take the night off & air a "Taxi".

— Tom Ceraulo (@tceraulo) August 3, 2012

Starting to think the uneven bars I bought this morning were just a stupid impulse buy... #Olympics

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) August 3, 2012

tweets.author_name: God Rest Ye Merry, Gentle Ben
tweets.html:
Anyone see that episode of THE TWILIGHT ZONE where Rod Serling just walked into the middle of the screen and started berating you by name?

— God Rest Ye Merry, Gentle Ben (@franzferdinand2) August 4, 2012

Good to see NBC shake it up tonight with the beach volleyball player crying instead of a gymnast.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) August 6, 2012

Dear @NBC, since your Olympics coverage is such crap, please consider giving Mary Carillo a role on #30Rock as Liz Lemon's aunt.

— Tony Bleach (@acbleach) August 6, 2012

McKayla Maroney would easily win gold in Death Stare.

— SportsPickle (@sportspickle) August 6, 2012

Oscar Pistorius better listen to Landry's band Crucifictorious, or what's the point?

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) August 6, 2012

Will SNACKAvoy amirite #marijuana #thenewsroom

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) August 6, 2012

If you don't like Skyler/Anna Gunn after tonight's Breaking Bad, you can probably just go ahead and unfollow me.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) August 6, 2012

Thanks to #BreakingBad, I can pretty much never sleep on Sundays. This is a problem. Sorta.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) August 6, 2012

Surprised NBC's Andrea Kremer didn't walk into "Breaking Bad" after Skyler was pulled from the pool & ask what this moment means to her.

— Dan Zak (@MrDanZak) August 6, 2012

Cooking meth and being a college professor: two jobs in which it's next to impossible to keep work only at work. #BreakingBad

— Tony Bleach (@acbleach) August 6, 2012

"Why is everyone being so mean to the awesome sociopath?" #shorterBreakingBadviewing

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) August 6, 2012

There's no way smoking meth is as addictive or stressful as watching Breaking Bad.

— Funny Or Die (@funnyordie) August 6, 2012

NBC has a 6 hour delay for events 3000 miles away. NASA has a 15 minute delay for an event 150,000,000 miles away.

— Matt Nunogawa (@amattn) August 6, 2012

It's unbelievable; we can put a robotic explorer on the surface of Mars, but we cannot craft a decent promo for that new vet show on NBC.

— ðŸŒŽJoshua MalinaðŸŒŽ (@JoshMalina) August 6, 2012

Every time NBC throws it to Ryan Seacrest, the ghost of Jim McKay sucker punches Roone Arledge.

— Philip Michaels (@PhilipMichaels) August 6, 2012

85% of arguments overheard in LA are rehearsals.

— Kristen Smith (@SpaceGirlK) August 6, 2012

Brandi, you have met your match RT @SamuelLJackson MASSIVE HEADER by Morgan in extra time for US Soccer WIN!!! THRILLING SHIT!!! Go USA!!!!!

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) August 6, 2012

Just imagine how much more exciting that Alex Morgan goal would be if we were all watching it six hours from now on tape delay.

— ðŸŽ„Chris WilsonðŸŽ„ (@realchriswilson) August 6, 2012

I don't mind NBC's delays of Olympic events. What I mind is that they recreate them with crappy "Unsolved Mysteries" actors.

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) August 6, 2012

Apolo Ono is the Mark McGrath of the Olympic games.

— Chris(tmas name) (@djgristle) August 6, 2012

In which I learn that Melanie Griffith is on Raising Hope. MT @EW Wilmer Valderrama to play Melanie Griffith's love interest on Raising Hope

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) August 7, 2012

Olivia Munn's appearance in the credits for #TheNewsroom looks like it was pulled from a Funny or Die parody.

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) August 7, 2012

NBC, you're just daring me to read a book with this story on Greenwich Time... #Olympics

— Eric Stangel (@EricStangel) August 7, 2012

NBC now explaining latitude and longitude and oh god this is a field trip you tricked us

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) August 7, 2012

Beach volleyball is the booger-picklejuice flavor ice cream of Olympic events

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) August 7, 2012

Once again, no uneven bars routine will finish with someone kicking a velociraptor in the face so count me out.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) August 7, 2012

The most unbelievable thing about #TeenWolf isn't the teen wolves. It's that Derek Hale isn't getting banged around the clock.

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) August 7, 2012

Daniel Palladino has a) Never spoken to a teenager after roughly 1997 and b) Not figured out Lorelai and Michelle are not the same person.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) August 7, 2012

I swear I am going to drive to L.A., storm the #Bunheads set and burn Boo's high-waisted jeans TO THE GROUND.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) August 7, 2012

(Mind you, there's also evidence Daniel Palladino has never met ANY real teenagers, but I'm choosing to give him some credit). #Bunheads

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) August 7, 2012

Dan Harmon, I love you, but do you want to be the unemployable eccentric forever?

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) August 7, 2012

PRACTISE interviewing an Olympic athlete by talking to someone you have just tried to drown. (via @milesorru)

— Twop Twips (@TwopTwips) August 7, 2012
